geninfo.para: Many radios are judged to be defective before the technician has checked for some of the basic symptom causes. This TSI is issued as a guideline to be used for basic radio troubleshooting in an effort to reduce the number of units that are replaced but are not defective. These guidelines contain the most common complaints along with simple tests that will help find and correct problems while the radios are still in the truck.

svcproc.title: Procedure
svcproc.para: The following checklist should be used to diagnose radio problems before a radio is replaced.

step1.para: No power - radio appears to be dead.

step2.para: Check fuse in truck. Both ignition and power (+12VDC all the time) feed (when applicable). These feeds are the red and yellow leads in the radio harness.
Check inline fuse in radio harness (if applicable).

Reset the radio. Models CRW400, CQ4300, CQ4400, CQ4500, CQ5200, CQ5300, CQ5400 and CQ5500 can be reset with the reset switch on the front of the radio faceplate, see Figure 1. If the unit does not respond when the function buttons are pressed, press the reset switch with a small pointed object such as a pencil point. This will restore the radio to its default settings. Radio power switch has to be pushed after resetting to turn power back on. The memory on the 6 preset station buttons will be lost when the radio is reset.

step1.para: No sound but faceplate display is on.

step2.para: Check balance and fade controls on radio.
Check wiring to radio (radio wire harness), make sure connectors are tight.

Check wiring to speakers. Test at radio for shorts between wires and each speaker wire to ground. These radios are protected for shorts and overloads on the speaker output. If speaker wires are shorted to themselves or ground the audio will shutdown (self-protect) with no audio output. Should this occur, the display will remain active.
Volume is lower on tapes than radio, check for dirty tape heads.

step3.para: Check for tape fragments or other foreign matter in the tape player.
Volume control is at the minimum level.
Vibration of radio can cause CD to skip. This is normal.
CD player may skip with dirt or scratches on bottom side.

step2.para: CD won't eject, check for pressure on top of unit.
